---
category: news
title: "To track a forest’s recovery, artificial intelligence just listens"
excerpt: "The sounds of a forest – from the guttural croaking of frogs to the chirpy trills of birdsong – can be used to track biodiversity recovery, according to a study published today in the journal Nature Communications. Paired with artificial intelligence, soundscapes can provide a low-cost way to measure the health of an ecosystem."
